dialogues.Annie: Excuse me.  How far is Camp Crystal Lake?  Can I get a bus or something?  Name's Annie.  I don't know.  Camp Crystal Lake?  No sweat.  Thanks a lot for the lift.  Hiya!  I'm headed for Camp Crystal Lake. Can you help me out?  I can't remember being this excited about anything.  I want to be a teacher when I finish at Southern State.  I guess I've always wanted to work with children.  I hate it when people call 'em kids.  Sounds like little goats.
dialogues.Steve: Wanta give me a hand here?      Push on this side.  Alice, this is Jack, Marcie and Ned.  Push.    I'd rather she painted.  Let's go, folks.  Shim it up just a scooch.      Perfection. Did you meet Brenda?    Come on back here and let's above the float in.  You draw very well.  This isn't your cup of tea, hunh?      You may not care a lot about this place, Alice, but I mean to make it my whole life.  It's been my whole life.  Gimme a chance.  Stay a week.  Help get it ready.  Next Friday, if you're not happy, I'll put you on the bus myself. I'll be grateful.  Thanks, Alice.    Yeah.  Brenda, after lunch hit the archery range.  If Annie gets here, have her start in on the kitchen.  Do your best.  Tomorrow we have a preliminary inspection by the state safety people. I'd like to look good.  No, thanks.  I'm fine.  Sandy.    I have six new counsellor up there. They're all babes in the woods in every sense of the word.  I mean...  Yeah.  I got it on before this-- --all started.  For two lonely nights.             I think water got into the electrical system.  You ride me back to camp?  I'll get one of my counsellors to drive me back tomorrow morning.  You've made a science out of coincidence.  Sure.    Yeah.  Hi.  What are you doing out in this mess?
dialogues.Ned: There you are dead wrong.  Sometimes I only think about kissing women.  I was just wondering if you thought there'd by any other gorgeous women at Camp Crystal Lake.  Besides yourself.  What about the dope paragraph in Mr. Christy's letter?  Yeah, and it also look like it hasn't seen a coat of paint in six years.  I thought we had two weeks...  Looks good.  He neglected to mention this place is called "Camp Blood" downtown.  Some campers drowned.  Then some counsellors got killed.  Late fifties sometime.  They never caught the guy who did it either.  Did anyone ever tell you you're beautiful when you're angry?  Want to see my trick shot?  It's even better.  God, but I love that sexy talk.  What do you want to be when you grow up?  Girls can't be cowboys.  Jack?  Doctor.  Now, if you were a flavor of ice cream, what would you be?  There are sand sharks in this lake and they can eat the bathing suit right off you.      Holy shit...  Wait, wait!   When I was finding these goodies in the shed.  I also found this letter which a camper never sent home. Listen.        The squaws are revolting!  God, but I love that macho talk! Emergency generators!  The Indian used campfires.  What hath God wrought?  Ha!  You wily oriental!  The phone was "Mr. Watson, come in here, I need you." I hope that's the last time we see the Camp Crystal Lake Drama Program.  I don't blame him.  Yeah, like draining the lake!     Makes me want to hold on and never let go.  I love you.    He keeps on acting like such an asshole!  Don't call him.  I guess...  I'm a little scared of storms.  Always have been.  Since I was a kid.  I've dreamed this dream.  Maybe half a dozen times.  There is a thunderstorm. The rain comes down like pebbles.  I can hear the sound.  I try to close my ears off.  It doesn't work.  The sounds gets louder.  The rain turns to blood and the blood washes down in little rivers.  And the sound stops.  I call it my shower dream.  Lead the way!  Are you wet?  Mmmmmmmph?  Best over...  Like waves. Whew.  Floor probably leaks.  This area is full of springs.  Just in cause this bugger goes bad.  I'm gonna pick up some lanterns from the equipment shack.  What is it?  Roll him over! I don't love Neddy.    I thought you wanted to give him one of your motherly lectures.  Ned is gonna do whatever he wants to do, you know.  Looks like a storm.  You?  The brick?  It's just a dream. Now I'm only eleven hours behind schedule.  Steve is going to have a small cow.     And then Steve looks at you with those hurt eyes--like you don't care about children...    You're very nice.                Help!        How the... did he get in there?  Okay.  Can I help?  The way I feel, that's perfect.  Bad bulb or no power.  It's getting a little gloomy in here.  Tomorrow is another day.  This just plain ain't my day.  Somebody probably dropped something too hard.  Help him!                     Oh, my God!  Ned?  We're gonna be working together for a while.  You're a nice guy without all the entertainment, okay?  Sure.  You're welcome.  He went to bed early.  Jack and Marcie are gonna be drenched.  I'm not always this stupid.  It wouldn't matter except Steve should be getting back pretty soon.  It wouldn't look so great if he fell over them.  Well, it hasn't been that long.  I think we should go wake them up.  Just in case.  I guess...  Good night, Brenda.  Absolutely.  I don't here it anymore.  It sounded like Brenda.  Did somebody leave the lights on at the softball field?  They're off now.  Okay. The killer is still out there.  Maybe we should wait for Mr. Christy.  I don't understand.    Mr. Christy will be back soon.  I won't let you!    Where are the goddamned bullets?  Please...  Help me.

description: In 1957, a young boy named Jason drowns in a lake near Camp Crystal Lake. The next year, two counselors are murdered. In 1980, a descendant of the original owners reopens Camp Crystal Lake with some counselors' help. The counselors gets killed one by one by a mysterious person. Could it be Jason, out for revenge?—RedJames99
name: Friday the 13th
